tests module¶

class tests.Test(description, proc)¶

Bases: object

An encapsulation of a test function and its description

tests.test_add_user()¶

Tests the instantiation of a User object to the database :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_empty_post_not_allowed()¶

Tests whether empty posts are denied from being added to the database :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_forum_posts()¶

Tests whether forum posts are properly added and referenced :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_forum_questions()¶

Tests whether forum questions are properly added and referenced :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_non_completed_user_not_in_db()¶

Tests whether a User object with incomplete parameters is denied from database :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_password_verification()¶

Tests the password verification method :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_search_query()¶

Tests the user search query method to determine whether the change of filter criteria works properly :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_search_query2()¶

Tests whether a user can be found by entering either first or last name :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_unique_email()¶

Tests whether only unique email addresses are allowed :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_unique_username()¶

Tests whether only unique usernames are allowed :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.test_user_posts()¶

Tests whether user post objects are properly added and referenced :return: tuple (boolean, message list)

tests.tester(test_obj)¶

Takes a test object, displays its description, and runs the test :param test_obj: a Test object :return: void

tests.write_output(msg)¶

Writes test output lines to the defined file :param msg: the string to write :return: void
